post.title: New Poll Shows Majority of Americans Now Oppose Black Lives Matter – Summit News

body: That's actually a good point. I used to work for a place that did political/social issue polls (as well as taco bell customer service surveys) and they are not typically trustworthy. There are certain kinds of people who do them, certain demographics that are more likely to answer, and even times of day that effect respondents. "Majority of Americans" is likely more like "majority of Americans *surveyed*"
body_html: That's actually a good point. I used to work for a place that did political/social issue polls (as well as taco bell customer service surveys) and they are not typically trustworthy. There are certain kinds of people who do them, certain demographics that are more likely to answer, and even times of day that effect respondents. "Majority of Americans" is likely more like "majority of Americans surveyed"

post.title: New Poll Shows Majority of Americans Now Oppose Black Lives Matter – Summit News

body:
Considering every supposed thing BLM protests falls apart the second it's analyzed, I don't support any of it.  All lives matter, period.  Equality, not superiority.  Statistically black people are killed by police at the same rate as whites per capita adjusting for the increase in crime committed by black people compared to white people per capita.  Also no difference shown between black and white officers.  Stats also don't factor in the amount of times the perpetrator threatened the lives of the officers to instigate the escalation, so for all we know more whites per capita and adjusted for crimes committed could be killed more often for unjustified reasons.

We keep getting told there is racism when there isn't, or at the very least not any institutional racism.  The only institutional racism present today is affirmative action and minority scholarships that tell poor white people to get fucked.  Hope the poor white people can scrounge together all of that privilege while their black neighbor goes to college on a free ride and gets a job they weren't qualified for to meet a quota.  

Everyone deserves equality of opportunity, but fuck this "well this happened 100 years ago so you owe us" shit.
body_html:
Considering every supposed thing BLM protests falls apart the second it's analyzed, I don't support any of it. All lives matter, period. Equality, not superiority. Statistically black people are killed by police at the same rate as whites per capita adjusting for the increase in crime committed by black people compared to white people per capita. Also no difference shown between black and white officers. Stats also don't factor in the amount of times the perpetrator threatened the lives of the officers to instigate the escalation, so for all we know more whites per capita and adjusted for crimes committed could be killed more often for unjustified reasons.

We keep getting told there is racism when there isn't, or at the very least not any institutional racism. The only institutional racism present today is affirmative action and minority scholarships that tell poor white people to get fucked. Hope the poor white people can scrounge together all of that privilege while their black neighbor goes to college on a free ride and gets a job they weren't qualified for to meet a quota.

Everyone deserves equality of opportunity, but fuck this "well this happened 100 years ago so you owe us" shit.

post.title: New Poll Shows Majority of Americans Now Oppose Black Lives Matter – Summit News

body:
I've researched all of the flagship police brutality cases that people keep citing and in every one of them the police really didn't do anything wrong.  Even Rodney King, the guy that set off the whole "police brutality" outrage, ran from police to escape a DUI charge at double the speed limit and endangered countless lives.  He deserved to get beat for endangering so many people while drunk driving and speeding through residential areas where he could've splattered kids and who knows who else.  And yes, I would say the same thing if he was white.  Act like human garbage, get treated like human garbage.

Direct from Wikipedia on Rodney King:

>At 12:30 a.m., officers Tim and Melanie Singer, husband and wife members of the California Highway Patrol, noticed King's car speeding on the freeway. They pursued King with lights and sirens, and the pursuit reached 117 mph (188 km/h), while King refused to pull over.[10][11] King later said he tried to outrun the police because a charge of driving under the influence would violate his parole for his previous robbery conviction.[12]

>King left the freeway near the Hansen Dam Recreation Area and the pursuit continued through residential streets at speeds ranging from 55 to 80 miles per hour (90 to 130 km/h), and through at least one red light.[13][14][15] By this point, several police cars and a police helicopter had joined in the pursuit. After approximately 8 miles (13 km), officers cornered King in his car.

80 mph in likely a 25 or at most 35 mph zone.  Anyone crossing the street would've been destroyed if he had hit them.  Also had prior robbery charges and was fleeing to avoid a DUI charge and therefore a violation of his parole.  What a saint.
body_html:
I've researched all of the flagship police brutality cases that people keep citing and in every one of them the police really didn't do anything wrong. Even Rodney King, the guy that set off the whole "police brutality" outrage, ran from police to escape a DUI charge at double the speed limit and endangered countless lives. He deserved to get beat for endangering so many people while drunk driving and speeding through residential areas where he could've splattered kids and who knows who else. And yes, I would say the same thing if he was white. Act like human garbage, get treated like human garbage.

Direct from Wikipedia on Rodney King:

At 12:30 a.m., officers Tim and Melanie Singer, husband and wife members of the California Highway Patrol, noticed King's car speeding on the freeway. They pursued King with lights and sirens, and the pursuit reached 117 mph (188 km/h), while King refused to pull over.[10][11] King later said he tried to outrun the police because a charge of driving under the influence would violate his parole for his previous robbery conviction.[12]

King left the freeway near the Hansen Dam Recreation Area and the pursuit continued through residential streets at speeds ranging from 55 to 80 miles per hour (90 to 130 km/h), and through at least one red light.[13][14][15] By this point, several police cars and a police helicopter had joined in the pursuit. After approximately 8 miles (13 km), officers cornered King in his car.

80 mph in likely a 25 or at most 35 mph zone. Anyone crossing the street would've been destroyed if he had hit them. Also had prior robbery charges and was fleeing to avoid a DUI charge and therefore a violation of his parole. What a saint.
